Crash resilient -- nursing care non-discretionary. Japan +2 (extreme aging). CMS compliance complexity creates moat. Staffing crisis makes AI adoption urgent.

models.name: AI-Native PR/Communications Agency
models.one_liner: Full-service AI PR agency: media monitoring, press release drafting, journalist matching, crisis response, social listening. NAICS 541820: 66K employees, 15K establishments, $135K avg pay (Baumol 1.86x). AI can handle 80% of PR tasks (monitoring, drafting, distribution) with human review for strategy and relationships.
models.key_v3_context: Strong 3-force alignment (F1+F2+F4). Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: Nursing Facility Operations Platform
models.one_liner: Platform for skilled nursing + residential care facilities: shared staffing, compliance, clinical documentation infrastructure
models.key_v3_context: silver_tsunami=F2, regulatory_fragmentation=F3+F5. 4 forces = FORCE_RIDER (FA=7). Overlaps with C7-FSR-NURSING-01 but platform architecture. Demographic inevitability + regulatory complexity = strong SN. Japan +2. CMS compliance creates genuine moat. Crash resilient. Capital moderate for platform build.

models.name: Japan Care Economy AI Platform
models.one_liner: AI + robotics platform for Japanese elder care facilities, reducing staff-to-resident ratios from 1:3 to 1:8 via autonomous monitoring/assist.
models.key_v3_context: Japan is the leading indicator for aging economies (median age 49, population declining 900K/yr). By 2040, Japan needs 2M+ care workers but working-age population is shrinking. There is NO human solution — AI + robotics is the ONLY path to maintaining elder care quality. Japan already has the highest robot density and highest cultural acceptance of robotic assistance. v2 had no Japan-specific models because sector scanning is US-centric, but Japan's aging crisis is 5-10 years ahead of US/EU — solutions developed here will export globally.
models.macro_source: Japan Aging Crisis (Median Age 49, -900K/yr)

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Commercial Print Shop
models.one_liner: Acquire retiring-owner commercial print shops (28K establishments, declining employment) and modernize with AI workflow automation, predictive maintenance, and personalization engines
models.key_v3_context: Declining employment -6.1% signals active cascade -- this is NOT pre-disruption like CNC, it's further along the destruction curve. SN lower because print is secularly declining in many categories. Only 2 forces (F1+F2), so FA is weaker. The print-on-demand growth segment ($59.3B by 2033) is real but requires strategic repositioning of acquired shops. CE decent: shops available at $200K-$1.5M with existing cash flow. TG reasonable with physical assets but the secular decline headwind limits upside. Must filter ruthlessly for growth segments (packaging, large format, personalized).

models.name: Home Health/Elder Care Platform Infrastructure
models.one_liner: Platform infrastructure for the fragmented elder care economy: shared scheduling, credentialing, compliance, and care coordination across 981K establishments
models.key_v3_context: Similar thesis to FSR-HOMEHEALTH-01 but as platform infrastructure rather than full-service replacement. SN remains high (demographics make elder care platform structurally necessary). F2 demographics + F4 Coasean shrinkage (fragmented providers needing coordination). GG better: aging is global, Japan +2, EU +1. But platform infrastructure is a harder business model than full-service replacement -- requires ecosystem buy-in from fragmented providers. TG moderate: digital platform. CE moderate: platform requires significant build before revenue. CONDITIONAL on achieving platform adoption across fragmented provider ecosystem.

models.name: AI Dispatch + Operations Platform for Freight Carriers
models.one_liner: AI-native dispatch, route optimization, and load matching for the 127K general freight trucking establishments
models.key_v3_context: F1 (AI dispatch + route optimization) + F4 (Coasean shrinkage creating micro-carriers). SN real: freight trucking is structurally necessary infrastructure with 127K establishments. But convergence risk: logistics AI is crowded (Uber Freight, Convoy was acquired, Loadsmart, etc.). GG moderate: freight/logistics is inherently global with cross-border applicability. TG moderate: digital platform but trucking has immediate revenue. CE good: SaaS operations model. CONDITIONAL because the logistics AI space is extremely well-funded and competitive -- must find specific underserved subsegment.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Tier 2/3 Auto Parts Supplier
models.one_liner: Acquire small auto parts manufacturer, deploy AI quality inspection + predictive maintenance
models.key_v3_context: F1 robotics + F2 silver tsunami. Physical asset crash resilience. Auto parts cyclical risk in late Perez. OEM concentration risk limits geographic spread. SBA 504 eligible.

models.name: AI Hospital Operations Intelligence
models.one_liner: AI operations layer for hospitals: patient flow optimization, OR scheduling, staffing prediction, supply chain management. NAICS 622110: 4.9M employees, 10.8K establishments, $81K avg pay. $394B total wages = MASSIVE addressable labor cost. Hospitals concentrated at top but operationally similar — platform sells to all. Epic/Cerner are EHR, not operations AI.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI-Native Private Household Services Platform
models.one_liner: AI matchmaking and operations for private household employers (nannies, housekeepers, private chefs, estate managers). NAICS 814110: 207K employees, 198K establishments (near 1:1 ratio = each employer is an 'establishment'). Declining employment (-2.5%) but growing demand — gap is matching + compliance (payroll tax, I-9). Care.com ($500M) acquired but limited AI.
models.key_v3_context: Strong 3-force alignment (F1+F2+F4)

models.name: AI-Native Dental Practice Rollup (Counter-PE)
models.one_liner: Acquire independent dental practices at 3-5x EBITDA (vs PE-paid 8-12x), deploy AI billing/scheduling/imaging, operate at AI-native cost structure PE rollups can't match
models.key_v3_context: Counter-PE thesis is compelling: F4 PE distress (11.98% distress rate, +148%) creates supply of practices at depressed multiples. F1 AI + F2 demographics (retiring dentists) add structural force. But PE dental space is SATURATED with 137 acquisitions in 2024 -- FTC scrutiny affects all consolidators, not just PE. Healthcare fear friction (gap 3) applies to AI in dental. GG low: US dental licensing and insurance system specific. CE hampered by practice acquisition costs and dentist retention complexity. TG moderate: physical assets help but regulatory risk from FTC actions. CONDITIONAL on navigating FTC scrutiny.

models.name: Acquire PE-Distressed Staffing Agency
models.one_liner: Acquire PE-distressed staffing agencies (employment declining 7.6%), convert to AI-native matching + dispatch model
models.key_v3_context: Staffing is the CANARY of the economy map: RHI -53%, MAN -44%, KELYA -25%. F4 PE distress creates supply at depressed multiples. F1 enables AI-native cost structure transformation. TG strong: the timing window is NOW (2-3 years of PE forced exits) and the thesis is immediately actionable. Administrative services ACCELERATION means the sector is being destroyed -- acquiring at distress pricing and converting to AI-native is the classic Schumpeterian play. GG low: staffing markets are national/local. CE good: acquire existing revenue at depressed multiples, immediately reduce costs with AI. TIMING_ARBITRAGE because TG >= 8 and SN >= 6.

models.name: AI Talent Agent / Artist Management Platform
models.one_liner: AI-native talent management for independent creators, athletes, entertainers. NAICS 711410: 30K employees, 7K establishments, $133K avg pay. AI handles: contract analysis, brand deal matching, scheduling, social media optimization, revenue tracking. Coasean: creators who needed a 15-person agency team now need AI + 1 human.
models.key_v3_context: Strong 3-force alignment (F1+F2+F4)

models.name: AI-Native Industrial Machinery Distribution
models.one_liner: Replace aging industrial machinery distributors with AI-native matching platform. NAICS 423830: 340K employees, 37K establishments. Many distributors are retiring-owner businesses — Silver Tsunami applies to distribution same as manufacturing. AI matches manufacturer specs to buyer needs, handles quoting, predictive reorder.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: pre_disruption

models.name: Manufacturing AI Deployment Stack
models.one_liner: AI deployment platform for small/mid manufacturers: plug-and-play modules for scheduling optimization, quality inspection, predictive maintenance, and production analytics
models.key_v3_context: Massive addressable market (300K+ establishments, 78-point AI gap) but platform infrastructure faces stiff convergence risk from AWS/Azure/GCP manufacturing modules. Only 1 primary force (F1 technology via robotics_ai + kondratieff_deployment). SN real but not uniquely served by a startup vs hyperscaler. GG strongest of manufacturing plays: global applicability across US/EU/Japan/India/SEA. TG weaker: pure-software platform at Perez turning point, no physical assets, 85% AI startup failure rate applies directly. CE moderate: consulting-led bootstrap possible but scale requires significant investment.

models.name: AI-Native Staffing Platform (Employment Services Disruption)
models.one_liner: Full-service AI staffing replacing traditional temp agencies: AI matching, automated credentialing, AI-managed onboarding, and real-time workforce management at 50-70% lower markup
models.key_v3_context: Administrative services at ACCELERATION with RHI -53% staffing canary is the strongest destruction signal in the economy map. SN is high: the REPLACEMENT of traditional staffing must happen. But FA is limited to 2 forces and the space is extremely crowded (Indeed, LinkedIn, many AI staffing startups). Fear friction gap 2 in admin is moderate. GG low: staffing markets are local/national with different labor regulations. TG moderate: digital platform but staffing revenue is real cash flow. CE decent: 20-30% markup model is volume-dependent but immediately revenue-generating. CONDITIONAL because of extreme competitive crowding.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Cabinet/Furniture Shop
models.one_liner: Acquire retiring-owner custom cabinet or furniture manufacturing shop, deploy AI-driven design-to-CNC workflow + robotic finishing for 40-60% throughput improvement
models.key_v3_context: Solid acquire+modernize thesis but weaker structural forces than CNC or plastics. Only 2 forces (F1+F2). SN moderate: cabinetry is housing-market dependent (cyclical). Design-to-CNC AI is maturing but less proven than CNC scheduling AI. GG moderate: furniture manufacturing is global but custom cabinetry is local market. TG good: physical assets + SBA + cash flow = crash resilient, but housing cyclicality is a Perez-coincident risk (turning point often coincides with housing correction). CE decent: $500K-$2M acquisition with SBA financing. CONDITIONAL on housing market trajectory.

models.name: Heavy Civil Construction Rollup with AI Project Management
models.one_liner: Consolidate 5-10 heavy civil contractors into AI-managed construction platform. NAICS 237: 1.1M employees across highway, power, and specialty construction. Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act creating $550B in new federal spending. Aging owners + massive backlog + AI project management = acquisition opportunity. SBA 504 eligible for equipment-heavy acquisitions.
models.key_v3_context: Rollup = capital intensive but crash-resilient at scale. Geographic variance 5.1 = regional play. Sector phase: pre_disruption. Strong timing window

models.name: Autonomous Undersea Systems AI
models.one_liner: AI navigation and mission planning for autonomous undersea vehicles (AUVs) performing ISR, mine clearance, and ASW operations.
models.key_v3_context: The Pacific strategic competition (F3 geopolitics) makes undersea capability a top priority. AUKUS specifically targets autonomous undersea systems. Submarines take 10+ years to build; autonomous UUVs can be deployed in 2-3 years. This is the asymmetric counter to China's naval buildup. However, technical uncertainty in GPS-denied autonomous navigation keeps this as CONDITIONAL.
models.macro_source: P-030 Defense AI Supercycle

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Commercial HVAC/Mechanical Repair
models.one_liner: Acquire retiring-owner commercial/industrial repair shops. Deploy AI diagnostics, predictive maintenance, remote monitoring. Physical assets (tools, test equipment, customer contracts) create convergence resistance. NAICS 811310: 236K employees. Data center cooling demand creating new growth in commercial HVAC repair.
models.key_v3_context: Physical acquisition = Perez-crash resilient

models.name: Human Premium Marketplace
models.one_liner: Verified marketplace for human-crafted services commanding 15-30% premium: artisan goods, hand-written content, human consultation, bespoke work.
models.key_v3_context: F5 psychology reveals a counter-current to AI adoption: 23% of people willing to pay 15-20% MORE for human services. This mirrors the organic food movement — a values-based market premium created by anxiety about the dominant mode of production. As AI content and services flood every market, the scarcity value of verifiably human work increases. This is a PURE EMERGING CATEGORY created by the AI transformation itself. No NAICS code exists for 'human-premium marketplace.' v2 could not detect it because it requires the F5 psychology framework.
models.macro_source: F5 Human Premium Signal (23% willing to pay 15-20% more)

models.name: AI-Native Local Specialized Freight
models.one_liner: AI-managed local specialized freight (not-for-hire exemption). NAICS 484220: 225K employees, 31K establishments. Local specialized freight (construction materials, refrigerated, flatbed) is fragmented and aging. AI handles: route optimization, load matching, regulatory compliance, predictive maintenance. Different from Convoy (long-haul general) — local specialized has relationship moats.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: AI-Native Business Association Operations
models.one_liner: AI operations for business/trade associations: member engagement, event management, advocacy tracking, research/reporting. NAICS 813910: 117K employees, 21K establishments. Associations are classic Baumol — membership dues rise with economy but operations haven't improved. AI handles: member communication, research briefs, regulatory monitoring.
models.key_v3_context: Strong 3-force alignment (F1+F2+F4)

models.name: AI-Native Electrical Distribution
models.one_liner: AI wholesale distribution for electrical apparatus and supplies. NAICS 423610: 195K employees, 19K establishments, $102K avg pay. Electrification trend (EV chargers, solar, battery storage) creating new product complexity that aging distributors struggle with. AI handles: product specification matching, code compliance, inventory optimization.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: pre_disruption

models.name: AI-First Management Consulting Delivery
models.one_liner: AI-generated consulting deliverables (market analysis, strategy reports, process optimization) at 10x lower cost than traditional firms
models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure maps F1+F2. Pure digital service, NOT crash resilient per Perez. Professional sector fear_friction_gap=3 helps adoption. But high convergence risk -- any LLM wrapper can do this. Capital efficient but low moat.

models.name: AI Infrastructure for Independent Insurance Agencies
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Insurance agencies (NAICS 524210, 971K employees, 158K establishments) consume accounting, legal, compliance services upstream. As those costs fall, margin improves — but agencies need AI for quoting, claims, customer service. Platform for 158K independent agencies. Applied Epic/Vertafore are pre-AI. Coasean: AI enables 1-2 person agencies to compete with 50-person shops.
models.key_v3_context: Strong 3-force alignment (F1+F2+F4). Sector phase: acceleration

models.name: Finance-as-a-Service API for Micro-Firms
models.one_liner: API-first financial infrastructure for the new micro-firm economy: invoicing, accounts payable, tax estimation, cash flow forecasting, and financial reporting as embeddable services
models.key_v3_context: F4 Coasean shrinkage (532K/mo business applications) is structurally creating the micro-firm economy this serves. F1 inference collapse enables real-time financial analysis. SN is real: micro-firms need financial infrastructure. But convergence risk is severe: Stripe, Mercury, and other well-funded fintech could expand trivially. GG moderate: API-first has some global applicability. TG weakest of the portfolio: pure-digital API platform with no physical assets, no recurring cash flow lock-in, facing well-funded incumbents at Perez turning point. CE good: API usage model scales efficiently. CONDITIONAL because of extreme convergence risk from Stripe/Mercury.

models.name: Multi-Shop Plastics Injection Molding Rollup
models.one_liner: Consolidate 3-5 plastics injection molding shops into AI-optimized production network
models.key_v3_context: Rollup variant of plastics injection molding with standard amplified risk. Same 2 forces (F1+F2). SN slightly lower than single-site because rollup adds execution risk without proportional structural advantage. GG better: reshoring + global applicability of injection molding. TG reasonable: physical assets but rollup complexity adds risk. CE worst of manufacturing plays: multi-facility capital requirements in plastics ($200K-$2M per machine) are heavy. CONDITIONAL on successful multi-site integration.

models.name: AI-Native Mortgage/Consumer Lending Operations
models.one_liner: Full-service AI lending operations for surviving mortgage/consumer lenders -- employment declining 9.8%, survivors need AI-native cost structure
models.key_v3_context: Financial services ACCELERATION with -9.8% employment decline = active destruction. F1 technology + F4 capital conditions (Fed 3.50-3.75%) shape lending economics. SN real: surviving lenders structurally need AI cost structure. Financial services fear friction gap = 1 (lowest, 73% adoption) means no psychology headwind. But lending is heavily regulated and dominated by large banks with their own AI investments. GG moderate: lending exists globally but regulatory regimes differ substantially. TG moderate: digital, rate-dependent business. CE decent: SaaS operations model. CONDITIONAL on differentiation from large bank AI investments.

models.name: AI Practice Management Platform for Independent Dentists
models.one_liner: Platform infrastructure for independent dental practices competing with PE-backed DSOs: AI scheduling, billing, imaging
models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure=F1+F2, pe_minsky_vulnerability=F4. PE wall $936B-$1.8T creates DSO pressure on independents. Platform enables survival of independents = structural. Healthcare fear_friction_gap=3. Dentrix/Eaglesoft incumbents slow to AI. US-centric dental market.

models.name: AI Operations for Assisted Living Facilities
models.one_liner: Full-service AI operations for assisted living: care coordination, family communication, medication, compliance -- 29K facilities
models.key_v3_context: silver_tsunami=F2 + baumol_cure=F1+F2. Demographic inevitability. 29K facilities fragmented market. Crash resilient -- assisted living non-discretionary. Healthcare fear_friction_gap=3. Similar to C7-FSR-NURSING-01 but assisted living less regulated than skilled nursing = lower moat.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Auto Body/Collision Repair
models.one_liner: Acquire retiring-owner auto body shops. Deploy AI estimating (photo-to-estimate), ADAS calibration capabilities, DRP management. ADAS-equipped vehicles require specialized calibration after collision — many shops can't do this. AI + ADAS calibration capability = competitive moat. Caliber/Service King at scale but thousands of independents.
models.key_v3_context: Physical acquisition = Perez-crash resilient

models.name: AI-Supercharged Construction Management
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native construction management firm. AI handles: scheduling, cost estimation, RFI processing, change order analysis, progress monitoring (drone/photo). PM focuses on relationships and problem-solving. 1 PM + AI manages projects that required 4-person team. Infrastructure bill + housing shortage = structural demand. Price competitively vs 20-person CM firms.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: pre_disruption

models.name: Africa/South Asia AI Compute Access Platform
models.one_liner: Platform providing affordable AI compute access to African and South Asian developers via Gulf-funded data centers and open-source models.
models.key_v3_context: The AI ecosystem bifurcation (P-028) and Gulf AI investment (P-031) together create compute access for emerging markets that was previously impossible. Gulf data centers provide the infrastructure. Open-source models eliminate the API cost barrier. Africa and South Asia have the demographics (3.4B people, youngest populations) but lack compute access. v2 had no emerging market compute model — this only becomes visible when you combine three patterns: bifurcation, Gulf investment, and demographic dividend.
models.macro_source: P-031 Gulf AI + P-028 Bifurcation + Emerging Market Demographics

models.name: AI Operations for Heavy/Highway Construction
models.one_liner: AI operations for highway/power line construction: project scheduling, equipment utilization, compliance tracking, progress monitoring (drone/satellite). NAICS 237310+237130: 584K employees. Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act ($1.2T) creating demand surge that existing workforce can't meet. AI extends each worker's productivity.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: pre_disruption

models.name: Multi-Shop Auto Repair Rollup with AI Diagnostics
models.one_liner: Consolidate 10-20 independent auto repair shops into AI-native network. Centralized diagnostics, parts procurement, scheduling. Shops at 2-3x EBITDA ($200K-$500K each). EV transition creating massive retraining need — AI-augmented shops handle both ICE and EV. Maaco/Meineke franchise model proves multi-unit auto repair works.
models.key_v3_context: Rollup = capital intensive but crash-resilient at scale

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Beauty Salon Chain
models.one_liner: Acquire retiring-owner beauty salons, deploy AI scheduling, inventory management, client personalization. NAICS 812112: 366K employees, est. 80K+ establishments. Low avg pay ($35K) but $200K+ revenue per chair. AI enables: predictive scheduling (reduce no-shows 30-40%), product recommendation, dynamic pricing.
models.key_v3_context: Physical acquisition = Perez-crash resilient

models.name: AI Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Process Optimization
models.one_liner: AI for pharmaceutical manufacturing: batch optimization, deviation management, process analytical technology (PAT), regulatory documentation (FDA 21 CFR Part 11). NAICS 325412: 228K employees, 4.7K establishments, $137K avg pay. FDA compliance documentation is 40-60% of pharma manufacturing cost — AI can reduce this while improving compliance.
models.key_v3_context: Strong 3-force alignment (F1+F3+F5). Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI Medical Device Lifecycle for Healthcare AI Adoption
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: As healthcare practices adopt AI (our HC models), they need AI-compatible medical devices and integration. AI medical device lifecycle: procurement, integration with AI diagnostic systems, regulatory compliance (510(k)), maintenance prediction. FDA SaMD (Software as Medical Device) framework creates compliance moat.
models.key_v3_context: Strong 3-force alignment (F1+F3+F5). Sector phase: pre_disruption

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Electronic Equipment Repair
models.one_liner: Acquire electronic/precision equipment repair businesses (oscilloscopes, medical devices, industrial controls). NAICS 811210: 106K employees. Retiring technicians with specialized knowledge. AI-assisted diagnostics + AR-guided repair extends capability of junior techs. Right-to-repair legislation expanding addressable market.
models.key_v3_context: Physical acquisition = Perez-crash resilient

models.name: Structural Metal Fabrication Rollup
models.one_liner: Consolidate structural steel/metal fab shops with shared AI layout + robotic welding capabilities
models.key_v3_context: F1+F2. Sub-variant of top-ranked CNC rollup (C7-RC-MFG-01). 78-pt manufacturing gap supports need. Physical assets + recurring infrastructure demand = crash resilient. But capital-intensive rollup. Structural steel tied to construction -- some cyclicality. Japan +1, EU +1 for manufacturing.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Surface Treatment Facility
models.one_liner: Acquire coating/engraving/heat treating facility, deploy AI process optimization + vision QC
models.key_v3_context: F1+F2. Surface treatment = critical manufacturing step, customers captive. Environmental permits create regulatory moat. Physical + SBA 504 eligible. Niche but defensible. Geographic limited to industrial clusters.

models.name: AI-Augmented Trade Training Platform
models.one_liner: AI-powered training for electricians/HVAC/plumbing: simulation, AR guidance, certification prep -- 499K workers needed
models.key_v3_context: silver_tsunami=F2 + kondratieff_deployment=F1. 499K workers needed = genuine pipeline gap. Training addresses supply side of demographic crisis. AR/AI-simulation trade training has no established NAICS category or dominant player. Crash resilient -- trades demand inelastic. Interplay with electrical/HVAC rollup models. Emerging category: AI+AR trade training is new modality.

models.name: AI Recruiting for Blue-Collar/Trades Workers
models.one_liner: YC-INSPIRED: Most AI recruiting targets white-collar/tech. Blue-collar/trades recruiting is different: skills verification, certification tracking, availability scheduling, geographic matching. 7.4M unfilled trade jobs (NAHB). AI handles: credential verification, skills matching, schedule optimization. LinkedIn/Indeed don't serve this market well.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: acceleration

models.name: Full-Service AI Marketing Agency
models.one_liner: AI-native marketing agency replacing traditional consultancies. NAICS 541613: 323K employees, 89K establishments, $102K avg pay. AI handles: market research, competitor analysis, campaign strategy, content creation, performance tracking. Jevons: SMBs ($1K-5K/month) access agency-quality marketing at 10x lower cost. 89K establishments = highly fragmented.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI Process Optimization for Refineries
models.one_liner: AI process optimization for petroleum refineries: yield optimization, predictive maintenance, emissions monitoring, blending optimization. NAICS 324110: 62K employees, 659 establishments, $171K avg pay. Small number of large facilities but each refinery spends $50-200M/year on operations. AI yield improvement of 1% = $10-30M/year per refinery.
models.key_v3_context: Strong 3-force alignment (F1+F3+F5). Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI Cybersecurity Operations for SMBs
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: As every business deploys AI, cybersecurity becomes critical. AI-native managed security for SMBs: threat detection, compliance monitoring (SOC2, HIPAA, PCI), incident response, vulnerability management. NAICS 541512: 1.14M employees but enterprise-focused. Gap: AI-native security operations at $500-2K/month for SMBs. SEC cyber disclosure rules + state privacy laws = regulatory tailwind.
models.key_v3_context: Strong 3-force alignment (F1+F3+F5). Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: Workforce Intelligence Platform
models.one_liner: AI staffing service entry + compounding workforce analytics database across industries, skills, and geographies
models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure=F1+F2, coasean_shrinkage=F1+F4. Staffing canary: RHI -53% validates disruption. Data compounding architecture strong long-term. But staffing is cyclical and RHI collapse signals demand destruction, not just tech disruption. LinkedIn dominates workforce data. Admin sector acceleration phase.

models.name: Financial AI Compliance Platform
models.one_liner: Multi-state financial AI compliance: lending fairness, algorithmic bias auditing, model risk management across banking regulators
models.key_v3_context: regulatory_fragmentation=F3+F5. Financial sector fear_friction_gap=1 (low fear = easier sell). Banking compliance is mandatory spend. EU AI Act Aug 2026 creates global demand (+2 EU). But single force family. OCC/FDIC/state regulator fragmentation is real. Capital efficient SaaS. Financial compliance somewhat crash resilient -- regulation tightens in downturns.

models.name: Multi-Territory Landscaping Rollup with AI Operations
models.one_liner: Acquire 15-25 landscaping companies across a metro region, deploy AI route optimization + scheduling + satellite property measurement. Shops at 1.5-2.5x EBITDA ($100K-$300K each). BrightView ($2.7B) validates rollup model but at enterprise scale — no AI-native SMB rollup exists. 122K establishments = deepest acquisition pool of any service sector.
models.key_v3_context: Rollup = capital intensive but crash-resilient at scale. Sector phase: acceleration. Strong timing window

models.name: AI-Supercharged Mortgage Brokerage
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native mortgage brokerage. AI handles: rate shopping across 100+ lenders, document collection/verification, underwriting pre-qualification, compliance checking (TRID, HMDA). Broker focuses on complex cases and relationships. 1 broker + AI handles volume of 5-person traditional shop. Rate environment volatility creating need for faster, more responsive brokers.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: acceleration

models.name: AI Compliance-as-a-Service for Regulated Industries
models.one_liner: YC-INSPIRED: Every regulated industry needs compliance. AI compliance-as-a-service: continuous monitoring, automated reporting, regulatory change tracking, audit preparation. Multi-sector (healthcare, finance, environmental, food safety). Each new regulation permanently increases value. Different from point solutions — horizontal compliance layer that works across industries.
models.key_v3_context: Strong 3-force alignment (F1+F3+F5). Regulatory complexity = permanent moat. Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI-Supercharged Veterinary Practice (New Entrant)
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native veterinary practice where AI handles diagnostics (radiograph interpretation, lab analysis), treatment protocols, client communication, inventory management. DVM focuses on procedures and complex cases. Throughput 2-3x traditional practice. Mars/IDEXX dominate corporate vet, but independent practices (75%+ of market) can compete with AI augmentation.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI-Supercharged Engineering Consulting (New Entrant)
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native engineering consulting firm. AI handles: structural calculations, code checking, report generation, CAD review, RFP response. Engineer PE stamp still required (moat). 1 PE + AI handles projects that required 5-person team. Infrastructure bill creating demand surge. Price at 40% of traditional engineering firms.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI-Native Tax Preparation Service
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native tax preparation for small businesses and individuals with complex situations (rental income, K-1s, multi-state). AI handles: data extraction, form preparation, optimization analysis, audit risk assessment. EA/CPA reviews and signs. TurboTax for simple returns, expensive CPAs for complex — gap in middle at $199-499 for AI-prepared + human-reviewed complex returns.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI-Native Video Production Studio
models.one_liner: Full-service video production at 80% lower cost using AI: script generation, storyboarding, AI-assisted editing, automated color grading, AI dubbing/localization. NAICS 512110: 206K employees, 25K establishments, $115K avg pay, DECLINING employment. Baumol cure in action. Jevons: 10x more businesses can afford professional video at AI-native cost. WARNING: tools layer crowded (Runway, Pika, Sora).
models.key_v3_context: Elevated competitive density

models.name: AI-Supercharged Architecture Firm (New Entrant)
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native architecture firm. AI handles: code compliance checking, energy modeling, rendering, construction document generation, specification writing. Architect focuses on design and client relationships. 1 architect + AI produces work of 5-person traditional firm. Infrastructure demand + housing shortage = structural demand growth.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: Elder Care Services Rollup with AI Operations
models.one_liner: Consolidate 20-50 elder care agencies into AI-managed network. 925K establishments = deepest acquisition pool of any sector. Agencies at 1-2x revenue ($100K-$500K each). AI enables: centralized scheduling, quality monitoring, predictive staffing, family communication. Medicaid compliance across states = regulatory moat. 65+ population growth = structural demand guarantee.
models.key_v3_context: Rollup = capital intensive but crash-resilient at scale. Geographic variance 5.8 = regional play. Sector phase: early_disruption. Strong timing window

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Specialty Dairy Producer
models.one_liner: Acquire artisan cheese/specialty dairy with AI process control + predictive maintenance for refrigeration
models.key_v3_context: F1+F2. Physical, revenue-generating, crash resilient (food staple). Specialty dairy (artisan cheese) has brand moat. Geographic limited -- dairy is regional due to perishability. Cold chain complexity adds operational risk. SBA 504 eligible.

models.name: AI Pipeline/Gas Distribution Operations
models.one_liner: AI for natural gas distribution: leak detection, pipeline integrity management, demand forecasting, regulatory compliance (PHMSA). NAICS 221210+486210: 147K employees. Methane reduction mandates (EPA Quad Ob) creating compliance urgency. AI leak detection (satellite + sensor fusion) can reduce methane emissions and compliance costs simultaneously.
models.key_v3_context: Strong 3-force alignment (F1+F3+F5)

models.name: AI-Supercharged Land Surveying Practice
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-native surveying practice using drone/LiDAR + AI processing. Traditional survey takes 2-3 days fieldwork + 1 week office processing. AI-native: 4-hour drone flight + same-day AI processing. PLS stamp still required (moat). Surveyor shortage (avg age 59, retiring faster than graduating). Price at 50% of traditional. Infrastructure bill creating demand surge.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI-Supercharged Physical Therapy Practice
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: AI-augmented PT practice. AI handles: exercise program generation, progress tracking (computer vision for range-of-motion measurement), billing/coding, patient communication, outcome prediction. PT focuses on manual therapy and complex cases. Throughput 2x with AI-guided home exercise programs monitored remotely. Jevons: AI monitoring enables treating 3x more patients.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI Operations for Engineering Services Firms
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Engineering services (NAICS 541330, 1.14M employees, 96K establishments) sits downstream of manufacturing modernization — as manufacturing adopts AI, engineering must also adapt. AI handles: CAD review, code compliance checking, structural analysis, project management, RFP response generation. $117K avg pay = significant Baumol energy. Infrastructure bill creating demand surge.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: Trades Intelligence Platform (Data Compounding from HVAC/Plumbing/Electrical)
models.one_liner: Start with AI operations for building contractors, compound into the definitive intelligence platform for trade service pricing, labor costs, and project benchmarks
models.key_v3_context: Data compounding thesis in trades is powerful at scale but faces the same early-years vulnerability as DC-HC-01. Construction PRE_DISRUPTION means the sector hasn't adopted AI yet -- good for opportunity but means longer runway to data scale. ServiceTitan ($9.5B) has data from enterprise contractors and could productize intelligence before a startup reaches scale. F1 + F4 (Coasean shrinkage creating micro-contractors) are the forces. GG low: US construction codes are jurisdiction-specific. TG moderate: early-years are a service business, not data business -- Perez crash risk during build phase. CONDITIONAL on reaching data scale before ServiceTitan or equivalent moves.

models.name: AI Back-Office for Community Banks
models.one_liner: Full-service AI back-office for community banks: loan processing, compliance reporting, customer service, fraud detection
models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure + ai_inference_collapse both map to F1+F2, so effectively 2 forces. Financial sector fear_friction_gap=1. Banking heavily regulated -- long sales cycles. Community banks consolidating (4,600 remaining). Not crash resilient -- banking stress correlates with credit cycles.

models.name: AI-Native Medical Laboratory Operations
models.one_liner: AI operations for medical/diagnostic laboratories. NAICS 621511: 231K employees. AI handles: test result interpretation assistance, quality control automation, sample routing optimization, billing/coding. Lab technician shortage (ASCP reports 20%+ vacancy rates) makes AI augmentation critical. Quest/LabCorp at enterprise but thousands of independent hospital and reference labs.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI-Native Veterinary Lab/Diagnostics Service
models.one_liner: AI-powered veterinary diagnostics: image analysis (radiology, cytology, dermatology), lab result interpretation, treatment recommendation. NAICS 541940: part of vet services. IDEXX dominates lab equipment ($14B) but interpretation is still manual. AI can provide specialist-level diagnostic interpretation to general practitioners at 10x lower cost. Jevons: rural/small practices access specialist diagnostics.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI Legal Operations for Mid-Market Companies
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Law firms (NAICS 541110, 1.08M employees, 187K establishments, $129K avg pay) serve every business in the economy. As AI collapses legal cost 50-80%, full-service AI legal ops replaces outside counsel for mid-market companies. Contract review, compliance monitoring, litigation analytics, regulatory tracking. Harvey, CoCounsel at enterprise — gap at $1K-10K/month mid-market.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI-Native Professional Staffing Agency
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: As traditional staffing declines (-7.6% employment), AI-native staffing firms gain share. AI handles: candidate screening, skills assessment, matching, interview scheduling, onboarding. Recruiter focuses on relationship management and complex placements. 1 recruiter + AI fills roles at rate of 5-person traditional team. Price at 10-12% fee vs traditional 20-25%.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: acceleration

models.name: AI Transaction Coordination Platform for Brokerages
models.sector_name: Real Estate - Offices of Real Estate Agents
models.one_liner: Platform infrastructure for real estate brokerages: AI transaction coordination, document management, compliance -- 163K establishments declining 5.2%
models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure=F1+F2, coasean_shrinkage=F1+F4. Real estate heavily US-centric, low intl transferability. 5.2% establishment decline signals disruption underway. Crowded proptech space limits SN. Not crash resilient -- real estate correlates with credit cycles.

models.name: AI Back-Office Replacement for SMBs
models.one_liner: Replace outsourced office admin services with AI: data entry, document management, scheduling, correspondence -- 78K establishments
models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure + ai_inference_collapse both F1-heavy. Admin sector in acceleration phase with fear_friction_gap=2. 78K establishments declining. Capital efficient AI service. But generic office admin is convergence-vulnerable -- every AI assistant does this. Low moat without vertical specialization.

models.name: AI Workforce Transition Services
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: As staffing industry declines (NAICS 5613, -7.6% employment), workers need transition services. AI workforce transition: skills assessment, reskilling pathways, job matching, career coaching. Different from staffing (placing bodies) — transition services (upskilling people). Government WIOA funding ($3B+/year) available. Every AI disruption cycle creates more demand.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: acceleration

models.name: AI SMB Financial Operations (Post-Bench, Post-Pilot Lesson)
models.one_liner: FAILURE STUDY: Bench ($113M), Pilot ($200M+), Decimal — all failed at human-heavy bookkeeping model. Lesson: full-service bookkeeping with 80% human labor doesn't scale. Opportunity: AI-native model where AI does 95% of work, human reviews 5%. At $0.05/month inference vs $150+/hour human bookkeeper. 35K Bench orphan customers immediately available. This IS our DC-FIN-01 but validated by 3 independent failures.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: Multi-Shop Commercial Print Rollup Platform
models.one_liner: Consolidate 5-10 commercial print shops into AI-native production network with shared workflow automation, centralized prepress, and distributed production
models.key_v3_context: Same secular decline concern as single-site print but amplified by rollup execution risk (70% M&A synergy failure rate). SN weaker than CNC rollup because structural necessity of print is declining. Only 2 forces. CE lower than single-site because of capital-intensive multi-facility rollup. TG moderate: physical assets help but print decline is a Perez-independent secular trend. The thesis depends on capturing growth segments at network scale -- this is a bet on repositioning, not on structural inevitability.

models.name: AI-Native Contract Cosmetics/Personal Care Production
models.one_liner: Contract manufacturing for DTC beauty brands: AI formulation, batch scheduling, QC, FDA compliance automation
models.key_v3_context: robotics_ai=F1, regulatory_fragmentation=F3+F5. FDA compliance moat for cosmetics/personal care. DTC beauty brand explosion creates demand for contract manufacturing. Physical production = crash resilient floor. Beauty somewhat discretionary but resilient in recessions (lipstick effect). Geographic: US primary, EU +1 for cosmetics regulation.

models.name: Full-Service AI Real Estate Appraisal
models.one_liner: AI-powered real estate appraisal replacing manual inspections with computer vision + comparable analysis. NAICS 531320: 30K appraisers, 14K establishments. Average age >55. Appraiser shortage creating 30-45 day delays. AI can do comps analysis in minutes, human reviews for 15 min. Full service at 50% of cost.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: Full-Service AI Commercial Equipment Repair
models.one_liner: AI-augmented commercial/industrial equipment repair: predictive maintenance, remote diagnostics, AR-guided repair for field techs. NAICS 811310: 236K employees. Equipment gets smarter (IoT sensors) but repair workforce aging. AI bridges: remote expert + on-site tech with AR guidance = 2x more repairs per tech per day.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: AI-Native Contract Research/R&D Services
models.one_liner: AI-augmented contract R&D services: literature review, experiment design, data analysis, patent landscape analysis, regulatory pathway mapping. NAICS 541714+541715: 830K employees, 47K establishments, $180K+ avg pay. AI can handle 60-70% of early-stage research tasks (lit review, data analysis, hypothesis generation). Jevons: small biotechs access Fortune 500-level R&D capabilities.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI Workforce Retraining for Disrupted Industries
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: As AI disrupts professional services, workers need retraining. AI-native reskilling platform for displaced accountants, paralegals, administrative staff. Personalized learning paths, competency assessment, job matching. NAICS 611430+611710: 258K employees. Government workforce development funds ($3B+ annually) available. Structural demand: every Baumol cure creates retraining demand.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: AI-Enhanced Dental Practice Operations
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: Dental practices enhanced by AI: radiograph interpretation, treatment planning, insurance verification, patient communication. Dentist stays for procedures but AI handles 60% of diagnostic/admin. Independent practices (120K+) compete better against PE rollups by having AI cost structure without PE debt.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: early_disruption

models.name: AI-Native Professional Training Delivery
models.one_liner: AI-native professional training: personalized learning paths, automated assessment, AI tutoring, simulation-based training. NAICS 611430: 54K employees. Baumol cure in education — instructor costs rising but AI can deliver personalized training at 10x lower cost. Jevons: 5x more workers access professional development at AI-native pricing.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: AI Operations for Petroleum Distribution
models.one_liner: AI operations for petroleum product wholesalers: demand forecasting, route optimization, regulatory compliance (EPA underground tank regs), hedging recommendations. NAICS 424720: 67K employees, 6K establishments, $117K avg pay. Declining long-term due to EV transition but still $50B+ market.
models.key_v3_context: Sector phase: pre_disruption

models.name: Full-Service AI Operations for Child Care Centers

models.key_v3_context: Child care crisis creates political urgency and federal funding, but Brightwheel ($600M+ valuation) is a dominant, well-funded incumbent. SN moderate: the operations platform is helpful but not structurally necessary (child care centers operate without it). F3 regulatory fragmentation (50 state licensing regimes) is real but Brightwheel already handles this. Only 2 forces and neither is particularly intense for this sector. GG low: US child care regulation and subsidy system specific. TG low-moderate: digital platform competing against dominant incumbent at Perez turning point. CE good: low capital requirements, SaaS model. CONDITIONAL primarily because of Brightwheel dominance.

models.name: Custom Cabinet Shop Rollup Platform
models.one_liner: Consolidate custom cabinet shops with shared AI design-to-CNC workflow and centralized finishing
models.key_v3_context: F1+F2. Housing-dependent -- NOT crash resilient in late Perez credit tightening. Custom cabinets tied to construction/remodel cycles. Physical assets provide some floor. Capital-intensive rollup. Geographic mostly US housing markets.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Specialty Confectioner
models.one_liner: Acquire family-owned specialty candy/chocolate company with brand equity, deploy AI tempering/molding + robotic packaging
models.key_v3_context: F1+F2. Sub-variant of food production theme. Brand equity transfers with acquisition. Confectionery somewhat discretionary -- less crash resilient than staple food. Geographic limited to local/regional distribution. SBA 504 eligible. Niche but viable.

models.name: AI-Native Hotel Operations for Independent Properties
models.one_liner: Full-service AI hotel management for independent hotels. NAICS 721110: 1.5M employees, est. 55K properties. AI handles: dynamic pricing, guest communication, maintenance scheduling, housekeeping optimization, revenue management. Marriott/Hilton have enterprise tech — independent hotels (40% of market) lack it. $500-2K/month replaces $50K+/year revenue manager.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: AI-First Design Agency (Full Service Replacement)
models.one_liner: Full-service AI design agency replacing traditional design firms at 5-10x lower cost -- 47,660 establishments, highest fragmentation in professional services
models.key_v3_context: Professional services EARLY_DISRUPTION applies but design is one of the MOST exposed to pure AI replacement (unlike accounting where trust/compliance matter). Only 1 force (F1 via baumol_cure + ai_inference_collapse). SN moderate: design services will always be needed but the race to the bottom on AI design pricing undermines the business model. FA weakest in portfolio: single force with no demographic, regulatory, or capital overlay. GG moderate: design is relatively global (visual output transcends language). TG weakest: pure-digital service in a commoditizing category at Perez turning point -- highest crash risk. CE excellent: near-zero marginal cost per project with AI. CONDITIONAL primarily on ability to maintain pricing power as AI design tools become ubiquitous.

models.name: Full-Service AI Advertising Operations

Spoilage reduction alone can improve margins 2-3 percentage points.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: AI-Augmented New Car Dealership Operations
models.one_liner: AI operations layer for car dealerships: lead scoring, inventory optimization, trade-in valuation, F&I product recommendation, service scheduling. NAICS 441110: 1.1M employees, 21K dealerships. EV transition creating massive retraining/retooling need. Dealerships are franchise-protected (state dealer laws) but operationally inefficient. CDK Global ($6B) shows platform market exists but is pre-AI.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: AI Operations for Oilfield Services

AI handles: drilling optimization, reservoir modeling, predictive maintenance, safety compliance. Halliburton/SLB at enterprise but thousands of independent service companies lack AI capabilities.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: AI-Augmented Real Estate Brokerage
models.one_liner: AI BENEFICIARY: Traditional real estate agents enhanced (not replaced) by AI: automated CMA generation, listing description writing, lead scoring, showing scheduling, contract review. NAICS 531210: 356K employees, 163K establishments. Agent stays for relationship/negotiation but AI handles 70% of research/admin. Agent productivity 2-3x higher = more deals per agent.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Glass Products Manufacturer
models.one_liner: Acquire specialty glass manufacturer (architectural, automotive, industrial) with AI process optimization + robotic handling

Energy-intensive manufacturing -- F6 energy costs could be headwind OR moat (efficiency advantage). Niche but defensible with environmental permits. Geographic tied to industrial clusters. Borderline PARKED at 59.75.

models.name: AI Bookkeeping for Restaurants (Bench Revival)
models.one_liner: Full-service AI bookkeeping targeting 1M+ independent restaurants: POS integration (Toast/Square), tip reconciliation, food cost tracking
models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure=F1+F2, jevons_expansion=F1. Sub-vertical of broader AI bookkeeping (rank 2). Restaurant-specific is defensible niche (Toast/Square integration) but limits TAM. Bench collapse creates orphans. Capital efficient. Restaurant sector cyclical -- NOT crash resilient. Timing good (Bench gap) but narrow window. Borderline PARKED at 59.75.

models.name: AI Educational Support Services
models.one_liner: AI-powered educational support: tutoring, test prep, academic advising, learning disability screening. NAICS 611710: 204K employees. AI tutoring can be 24/7, personalized, and 10x cheaper than human tutoring ($15/hour AI vs $60-150/hour human). Khanmigo exists but limited. Jevons: every student gets personal tutor.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: AI-Native Publishing Operations
models.one_liner: AI operations for periodical and niche publishers: content generation assistance, ad sales optimization, subscription analytics, audience segmentation. NAICS 513120+513199: 117K employees, 15K establishments, DECLINING employment. Baumol cure: editorial costs rising but AI can handle research, drafting, fact-checking. Full-service replaces 3-person editorial team.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: AI Administrative Operations for Higher Education
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Universities (NAICS 611310, 1.26M employees) are downstream consumers of accounting, legal, IT, and administrative services. AI operations for universities: admissions processing, financial aid optimization, course scheduling, research administration, donor management. Workday/Ellucian are pre-AI ERP — gap for AI-native university operations.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: Construction AI Permitting/Compliance Platform
models.one_liner: AI-driven building permit navigation + code compliance for residential and commercial construction across fragmented jurisdictions
models.key_v3_context: regulatory_fragmentation=F3+F5 only. Construction pre_disruption phase. Permitting is jurisdiction-specific -- US only, very local. Housing-cyclical reduces crash resilience. Capital efficient SaaS model. But single-force family (F3+F5 are correlated) limits FA score.

models.name: Construction Project Intelligence Platform
models.one_liner: Start with project management service, compound into definitive construction cost/schedule/labor intelligence database
models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure=F1+F2, coasean_shrinkage=F1+F4. Data compounding architecture is strong long-term. Construction pre_disruption. But construction cyclical -- NOT crash resilient. Procore ($10B+) dominates project management layer. Data moat takes 3-5 years to build, vulnerable period.

models.name: AI-First Engineering Analysis Service
models.one_liner: AI-powered structural/mechanical/electrical engineering analysis at 5x lower cost -- 167K establishments, $181B wages, 4.3% wage growth

AI can assist but NOT replace licensed engineer sign-off. Convergence risk moderate. Not crash resilient -- engineering tied to construction/capex cycles.

models.name: AI-Native Commercial Leasing Operations

AI helps: adaptive reuse analysis, tenant credit scoring, operating cost optimization.

models.name: Wholesale Trade Intelligence Platform (Data Compounding)

Every transaction reveals pricing patterns, demand cycles, supply chain relationships. At 10K transactions: predict commodity price movements, identify arbitrage. At 100K: become the Bloomberg Terminal of wholesale trade. 122K establishments = massive data collection surface.
models.key_v3_context: Data moat builds over time; vulnerable pre-scale. Sector phase: pre_disruption

models.name: AI Network Operations for Regional Telecoms
models.one_liner: AI network operations for wired/wireless telecoms. NAICS 517111+517810: 513K employees. AI handles: network optimization, predictive maintenance, customer churn prediction, capacity planning. AT&T/Verizon at enterprise but 1,300+ regional ISPs and CLECs underserved. 5G/fiber buildout creating new complexity.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: AI Operations for Regional Airlines/Charter
models.one_liner: AI operations for regional/charter airlines: route optimization, crew scheduling, maintenance prediction, fuel optimization, revenue management. NAICS 481111+481211: 521K employees. Major airlines have AI teams but 200+ regional/charter operators lack capabilities. Each 1% fuel savings = $100K-1M/year per aircraft.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: Veterinary AI Compliance + Operations Platform
models.one_liner: AI compliance and operations platform for independent veterinary practices navigating PE rollup pressure + emerging state regulations on veterinary corporate practice
models.key_v3_context: Niche regulatory moat play in veterinary. F3 (state regulatory backlash against PE vet consolidation) + F4 (PE distress) drive demand. But veterinary market is small (~$35B total), SN is moderate (compliance need is real but niche), and Digitail (1,000+ hospitals) + Shepherd are already in market. GG very low: US-specific veterinary regulation and PE dynamics. TG moderate: digital platform. CE decent: $200-800/mo subscription. PARKED because composite falls below 60 threshold -- niche market + existing competitors + limited geographic scope.

models.name: AI Credit Support Operations (Loan Servicing)
models.sector_name: Financial Services - Activities Related to Credit
models.one_liner: Replace human loan servicing/processing teams: emp -10.7%, wage +13.8% = classic Schumpeterian gap, survivors need AI
models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure only = F1+F2 but narrow force alignment. Employment -10.7% with wage +13.8% is textbook Schumpeterian gap. Financial sector fear_friction_gap=1 (low fear). But loan servicing is cyclical -- volumes drop in credit tightening. Not crash resilient.

models.name: AI-First Wholesale Brokerage Service
models.one_liner: Replace wholesale trade brokers with AI matching + logistics optimization -- 122K establishments, employment declining
models.key_v3_context: coasean_shrinkage=F1+F4, ai_inference_collapse=F1. Wholesale pre_disruption phase. Employment declining validates structural shift. But Faire ($12.4B) and similar platforms already in market. Intermediary displacement is structurally sound but competitively crowded.

models.name: AI-First Advertising Operations Service
models.one_liner: Full-service AI ad operations: campaign creation, optimization, reporting -- replacing traditional ad agencies at 5x lower cost
models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure + ai_inference_collapse both F1-heavy. Advertising is highly cyclical -- NOT crash resilient in late Perez. Convergence risk extreme: Google/Meta already automating ad ops. Platform dependence on Meta/Google ad APIs. Capital efficient but structurally weak necessity.

models.name: AI-Powered Micro-Firm Project Marketplace
models.one_liner: Marketplace connecting micro-firms (1-5 employees) for project collaboration, talent sharing, and capability assembly
models.key_v3_context: coasean_shrinkage=F1+F4, ai_inference_collapse=F1. Structural thesis (firms getting smaller) is sound but early. Upwork/Toptal/Fiverr dominate freelance marketplaces. Micro-firm collaboration is emerging category but unproven. Pure digital, NOT crash resilient. Capital efficient but low moat.

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Metal Foundry
models.one_liner: Acquire specialty foundry (aluminum, iron, steel casting), deploy AI pour optimization + robotic finishing -- 1,689 establishments
models.key_v3_context: F1+F2. Foundry work is essential manufacturing but energy-intensive (F6 headwind). 1,689 establishments = small market. Environmental compliance creates moat but also cost. Physical + SBA 504. Foundry acquisition capital-intensive. US foundry capacity declining -- could be positive (scarcity) or negative (market exit).

models.name: Full-Service AI Creative Operations for Independent Artists
models.one_liner: AI operations layer for independent artists/writers/performers. NAICS 711510: 60K employees, 39K establishments = HIGHLY fragmented gig economy. AI handles: invoicing, contract review, IP management, royalty tracking, marketing. Jevons: at $49/month vs $5K/month traditional management, 10x more artists access professional operations.

models.name: Acquire PE-Distressed Veterinary Practice
models.one_liner: Acquire PE-distressed veterinary practices at reduced multiples (PE paid 12-18x, available at 6-8x as PE exits), convert to AI-native operations with Digitail/Shepherd tools
models.key_v3_context: Time-limited arbitrage in veterinary PE distress. TG is the strength: PE exit window is real and time-bounded (2-3 years). But SN is limited (veterinary practice operation, not structural necessity), FA only 2 forces, and GG very low (US-specific). The arbitrage window thesis depends heavily on PE forced exits actually materializing in veterinary specifically -- less certain than in accounting or staffing where the distress signals are clearer. CE moderate: $1-3M per practice with physical assets. PARKED at 59.50 composite -- the timing arbitrage is real but the overall structural case is weak.

models.name: AI-Matched Contractor Marketplace
models.one_liner: AI-powered marketplace matching property owners with vetted building contractors, using job data for quality scoring
models.key_v3_context: F4 Coasean shrinkage + F2 Silver Tsunami (retiring contractors) create structural demand. But HomeAdvisor/Angi, Thumbtack, Houzz, and many others already compete heavily in this space. SN moderate: marketplace is helpful but contractors and homeowners already find each other through multiple channels. Only 2 forces with moderate intensity. GG low: local construction markets with jurisdiction-specific licensing. TG moderate: marketplace dynamics require critical mass, risky at Perez turning point without existing network. CE moderate: marketplace revenue model works at scale but reaching scale against incumbents is capital-intensive. PARKED because competitive landscape is extremely saturated.

models.name: AI Operations for State/Local Government Services
models.one_liner: SUPPLY CHAIN: Government is the largest downstream consumer of professional services. As AI collapses those costs, government operations must also modernize. AI for state/local government: permit processing, constituent services, records management, budget analysis. 12-24 month procurement cycles but DOGE-driven modernization pressure creating urgency. Tyler Technologies ($1.8B) is incumbent but pre-AI.
models.key_v3_context: Expansion model, 2 forces, full_service_replacement architecture

models.name: Acquire + Modernize Rubber Products Manufacturer
models.one_liner: Acquire specialty rubber products manufacturer with AI process optimization + robotic molding/finishing
models.key_v3_context: F1+F2. Rubber products is niche within manufacturing theme. Cyclical demand tied to automotive/industrial. Physical + SBA 504 eligible. But rubber manufacturing declining in US -- offshore competition. Lower SN than metal/food manufacturing variants.

models.name: AI Operations for Multi-Site Outpatient Centers
models.one_liner: Full-service AI operations for outpatient care networks: scheduling, billing, prior auth, clinical documentation
models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure=F1+F2 only. Healthcare fear_friction_gap=3. Outpatient care growing (shift from inpatient). But athenahealth, eClinicalWorks dominate healthcare ops. Single force family. Crash partially resilient -- healthcare demand inelastic but elective procedures cyclical.

models.name: Independent Practice AI Services Marketplace
models.one_liner: Marketplace connecting independent healthcare practices with AI service providers (billing, scheduling, documentation, compliance)
models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure=F1+F2, coasean_shrinkage=F1+F4. Healthcare fear_friction_gap=3. Meta-marketplace (connecting practices with AI vendors) has chicken-and-egg problem. AI vendor landscape shifting rapidly. Independent practices already served by athenahealth marketplace. Low structural necessity for intermediary layer.

FEAR_ECONOMY category because fear friction gap in mental health exceeds 3 (even though not explicitly measured in economy map, extrapolating from healthcare gap 3 + education gap 2 + legal ethical concerns 82% suggests mental health > 3). This is a sector where fear CREATES the market for compliance. But it's very early-stage: Utah HB 452 is one state, regulatory landscape still forming. GG very low: US state-level mental health regulation specific. Composite below 60 would normally be PARKED, but FEAR_ECONOMY categorization overrides because the fear-driven market creation dynamic is the thesis.

models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure=F1 only. Finaloop ($35M) is direct competitor in Shopify bookkeeping. Platform dependence on Shopify API. Shopify itself could add bookkeeping features. Tool-layer commodity. Narrow niche within already-served market. Capital efficient but no structural moat.

models.name: Platform Government AI

models.key_v3_context: regulatory_fragmentation=F3+F5 loosely. Tyler Technologies ($1.8B) dominates govtech. 12-24 month procurement cycles = terrible capital efficiency. Government AI adoption extremely slow. DOGE/efficiency efforts could accelerate but unpredictable. Not crash resilient -- government budgets cut in downturns.

models.key_v3_context: baumol_cure=F1. Abridge ($250M funding) has captured clinical documentation AI. Microsoft/Nuance DAX also dominant. Tool-layer commodity. No structural moat for new entrant. Healthcare fear_friction_gap=3 but market already served. Timing terrible.

No structural gap for new entrant. Financial sector fear_friction_gap=1 but irrelevant -- market captured.

models.key_v3_context: Minimal force alignment. Saturated market with well-funded incumbents (Calm, Headspace, BetterHelp). Consumer app = high CAC, low retention. NOT crash resilient -- discretionary wellness spend. No regulatory moat. No data compounding unique to entrant. Market over-served.

models.key_v3_context: Minimal force alignment. $10.5B already deployed by 7 unicorns. Most over-funded vertical in proptech. No structural gap. Timing worst possible. Real estate cyclical. Tool-layer commodity against massive incumbents.

Regulatory uncertainty in US (F3 negative). NOT crash resilient -- crypto correlates with risk-on sentiment. No demographic or geographic structural driver.

models.key_v3_context: Zero structural necessity for new entrant. GitHub Copilot (Microsoft), Cursor, Windsurf, Claude Code already dominant. Platform companies (GitHub, JetBrains) integrating AI natively. No moat possible against platform-integrated tools. Timing worst possible.
